page.title: 07Dotton Pumping Station
page.content: Dotton Pumping Station is on the road between Newton Poppleford and Colaton Raleigh.It has an automatic pumping system so most of the time no one is there but two men were there when we went.All the water comes from boreholes.There are three at Dotton. the water is pumped into the reservoir which holds half a million gallons of water which are pumped eight times a day. Every week a water sample is taken.You look through a thing a bit like a camera to match the colour of two samples of water to see if it is suitable to drink.This tests the chlorine content. Dotton Pumping Station supplies the water for part of Sidmouth.It gets the water from the reservoir at Core Hill. When there is a drought the man said people use too much water in their gardens.
